Subject: [sfraves] Loving homes NRR

One closet candy kid seeks loving home.

If it turns out I'm staying here in the bay (which looks like it may be
the case) I'm gonna need to find someplace to live near SFSU. Closer the
better: I'd like to be able to walk to class. :b

I'm still considering student housing and whatnot, but living with ravers
might be a little more suited to my uh active lifestyle.

As such, I'm looking for a room to let come september. 420 friendly people
are a plus. Someplace where I can chip in on high-speed net access is also
a plus. Cheap is always exceedingly good, as I will be poor and living on
other people's money. People that don't mind noise kick ass.

It'd be nice to have parking.

About me: Obviously, I party a lot. I'm fairly social, but like to be able
to seal myself away in a room and retreat to inner spaces every now and
then. I'm as messy as a pig in shit when it comes to my own room, but I'm
pretty respectful when it comes to common areas and roommates. I am not
involved in any satanic ritual abuse cults, but am open to joining one.

If anyone has any ideas, lemme know. :)

~TRH

<< S I S T E R U S A :: N E W S & U P D A T E S >> Spring 2003 

With 4 stateside SISTER locations and more on the way, the SISTER DJs are some of the most talented female DJs in the USA. Here's the skinny...

-------------------------------- SISTER SAN FRANCISCO http://www.sistersf.com -------------------------------- 
DJs: XJS :: SERAPHIM :: AMBER :: MELYSS :: POLYWOG :: AGNES B :: FOREST GREEN :: interns: elz :: samira 

news... 
AMBER (http://www.sistersf.com/bios/amber.php) now hosts and is Associate Producer of :CODE, a television show based on her residency and club night at DNA Lounge. The new show is broadcasting locally on three cable access stations, and also soliciting to get it pickup up by a network or major cable station. 
SERAPHIM (http://www.sistersf.com/bios/seraphim.php) recently signed with the Just Say Agency (http://www.justsayagency.com) , and is embarking on the 'broken bass 2003 tour' later this year. To book dates for this tour email justagency@aol.com. 
SISTER (http://www.sistersf.com) Be sure to check out Etc Magazine Article Featuring Sister SF's DJs. 

a few upcoming dates... 
SERAPHIM (http://www.sistersf.com/bios/seraphim.php) - May & June - Dates in Eugene, OR/ Seattle, WA/ Vancouver B.C. confirmed, to be announced 
June 8th - Club Compression with John B, Disco D, Havoc and Mason - 80's theme. 
AMBER (http://www.sistersf.com/bios/amber.php) - Friday, June 27 - Performing in a 2x4 (on four turntables at once) with DJ Dragn'fly at Divalicious 3 in Seattle, WA. 



-------------------------------- SISTER NYC http://www.sisternyc.com -------------------------------- 
DJs and MCs : LEJLA :: WINTER :: SIREN :: ICON :: MC LINZEE 

news... 
SISTER NYC new monthly! A night of breakbeat, drum'n'bass, deep house, tech-house and nujazz in the lower east side with resident DJs Vanessa Beck, Lejla, and Winter. Special guest Camea (www.djcamea.com) plus live vocals by Linzee.The party starts at 9pm, open decks from 7-9, sign-up @ 7pm . Drink specials 7-9. Free all night long! Every third Monday at Angel Bar. 174 Orchard St., btwn Houston & Stanton St. 
SISTER NYC in the in the NEW YORK POST (http://www.nypost.com) 



-------------------------------- SISTER PDX http://www.sisterpdx.com -------------------------------- 
DJs: JADE BASSIX :: VELO :: BLENDER :: MISS ILL :: PSYKE :: THUMPER :: THE PERFECT CYN :: GENESIS :: FLUTTERBY 

news... 
JADE BASSIX has a new CD about to be released titled 'dirtyThumpin' - chi-house.techno.electro mix by Jade Bassix and DJ Wikk!d. 

upcoming dates... 
JADE BASSIX May 16th - Seattle, WA - Rumble with AK1200, May 20th in Portland, OR - Virus Breaks Weekly, May 31st in Seattle, WA Safety Dance - Dancesafe Seattle Benefit 



new!! SISTER SEATTLE is formed ------------------------------------------ 
DJs: ELLETEE : MISS KICK : L.A. KENDALL : JULIE HERRERA : TAMARA : LISA BUSH : EMILY SONG : KRISTINA CHILDERS : MISS FUNK : JULIA CAMP 

news... 
SISTER - Sister Seattle launch party at Aristocrats in Seattle, Sunday May 31st 2003! Upstairs breaks and drum & bass with DJ Julia, Elletee, Aundroid, Tamara, and Naha. Downstairs 4 on the floor with Lisa Bush, Kristina Childers, Miss Kick & Brandy Westmore, L.A. Kendall & Julie Hererra, The Vixens of Vinyl (Miss Funk, Mini Funk, & Emily Song) Link to temporary site with flyer: http://onehorseshow.tripod.com 
www.sistersea.com coming soon! 

for more info, email sistersf@sistersf.com



seraphim . sarah delush 
 www.sarahdelush.com : www.sistersf.com 
 for bookings contact: 
 Just Say Agency   www.justsayagency.com 
 bookings@justsayagency.com  +1 (661) 265-1999

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] atlantis @ richmond civic center?  comments?

On Mon, 19 May 2003, Brandon @ Invibe wrote:

> word is atlantis is going to be at the richmond civic center.  i know that
> is an old school venue that was retired before i was into the scene.
>
> any comments?

Richmond Civic was a legendary venue for massives circa mid-'90's.

It's like a big version of Santa Cruz Civic, or a very-small version of
Henry J. Kaiser, kinda sorta. Dual-level civic center, balcony seating, a
very wide hallway that runs the perimiter (good enough for a 2nd area,
social space), a few small side rooms. Fits 4-5000 comfortably, good lord
if they try to put much more in there.

Gatherings, FTT's Le theater de futur, Area 51's....great memories =)

...not sure how the venue will be now with the scene's "tainted" status.
As I remember the venue was lost after an Area 51 due to a combination of
tagging, OD's, and residential complaints....I think.

-terry

------------------------------------
terry estioko | terry@viberation.com
http://www.estioko.com
http://www.viberation.com

From: Sarah Schumm <sarah_schumm@yahoo.com>
To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
MIME-Version: 1.0

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] Detroit/ Thanks for the memories

--0-1626321754-1053464049=:46900
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Back when I lived near Detroit, I had a really crappy car, I called it the "ratmobile" It was great because nobody wanted to steal it when I parked it near the clubs downtown!
 
My Folks house in Howell is still for sale after they split up a few years ago... It has 4 Bedrooms, a finished basement, a pool , and a Jacuzzi, the mortgage is $1000 a month, ($20 more than I pay in rent now for a one bedroom in Fremont) My husband And I are tempted to move there and start a DJ/ artist commune because of it's proximity to motown, it would accomidate another couple and 2 singles easy...so if you want in on our pipe dream and dream of Detroit, email me privately.
 
isn't it weird that a few teenagers in Detroit can
create a whole world making records, while legions of
grown-ups are still struggling after years and years?

in Urb they had an interview with the three original
techno dons, and they described the early days -- most
of it went like this:

Derrick May: and then I stole my mom's car.
Juan Atkins: and then you stole my mom's car.
Derrick May: right, we drove my mom's car into Detroit
and it broke down. so we told her it was stolen and
then I stole Juan's mom's car.
Kevin Saunderson: and then you stole my brother's car.
Derrick May: right.
Kevin Saunderson: you told me you had a license.
Derrick May: yeah. I was 14, but I had this fake ID
that kinda looked like a license.
 


--
Sarah Schumm <sarah_schumm@yahoo.com>
Hypnobunny Creative Services - Posters, Logos, Ads and More

---------------------------------

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Lungs bleeding of smoking


Why wait for your lungs to bleed to stop? Best thing to do for your health
is to quit. I recently lost someone close to me from cancer, trust me, you
don't want to be stuck in a hospital w/ a trache in your throat..."

From=20Yale, one of the leading medical schools:
http://www.yale.edu/uhs/departments/health_ed/fooled.htm

Clove Cigarettes
=09They contain twice as much tar and two to three times as much
nicotine as all-tobacco cigarettes.
=09The anesthetic character of cloves leaves clove smokers
susceptible to many serious respiratory problems including infections,
pneumonia, difficulty breathing, and bleeding from the lungs.
=09These symptoms, unlike those associated with nicotine intake, can
occur after one incident of clove smoking.


From=20http://www.colostate.edu/Depts/HHS/APresDrugsTobacco.htm#a2

"...Are Clove cigarettes worse for you than regular cigarettes?

Clove cigarettes can be deadlier than cigarettes. This "natural" tobacco
does not have anything to do with being healthier. Often times the clove
cigarettes contain higher concentrations of tar and nicotine and the smoke
has greater levels of toxic agents such as carbon monoxide, hydrogen
cyanide, ammonia and carcinogenic hydrocarbons. Smokers of clove
cigarettes also have increased risk of emphysema, heart disease and cancer
of the mouth, lungs and throat. The anesthetic character of clove leaves
the smokers susceptible to many serious respiratory problems including
infections, pneumonia, difficulty breathing and bleeding of the lungs.
These symptoms, unlike those associated with nicotine intake, can occur
after one incident of clove smoking. One more thing to remember is that
most clove cigarettes don=92t have a filter so you get the "full effect" of
those chemicals! Bottom Line: There is no SAFE cigarette!"

"...The active ingredient in cloves is a chemical called eugenol, which is
a potent topical anesthetic. There have been a few cases of inflammation
of the lungs with clove cigarettes, and any inhalation of substances will
have an impact on lung airways=97which can cause irritation, spasm, and
coughing. It can definitely be more dangerous if a person has asthma."

Good luck and whatever you decide, here's to better health and happiness,

Karina

Subject: [sfraves] My favorite book series...

--0-1254023608-1053468194=:18798
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

Just wondering if anyone has ever read the Hyperion series by Dan Simmons. All this discussion about the Matrix made me think of my favorite book series. It has many of the same themes as the Matrix such as the Machines using their human creators as organic computers for their own projects such as constructing a Machine "Ultimate Intelligence" or God and the conflict between the Human God and the Machine God. There are many religious tones to this series and like "The Matrix" doesn't really answer all the questions for you but leaves you exploring new questions instead. I highly reccomend it!
 
Amber

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity Twelfth Anniversary Friday!!!!

--=====================_1184034==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic, 
tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of 
years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal 
music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same beat, 
between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people 
shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and psychedelic 
alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're going 
back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and 
visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.

Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)


COME-UNITY:  Twelfth Anniversary Party

WHEN: THIS FRIDAY, MAY 23RD

WHERE: MEZZANINE, 444 Jessie Street, San Francisco

On the turntables:

Mark Farina (OM Records)

Jeno (Wicked)

Simon (Come-Unity; Future Dreams)

Cosmik Jason (Imperial Dub)

DJ Adnan with Drum Fire

10:00pm - 5:00am, $15, 21+



MALACHY ON HOUSE

"When used with positive intention, Group energy has the potential to help 
restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the 
whole group you dance with; when you feel love with everyone, and they 
return it, a higher vibration can be reached. This happens when a crowd is 
deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the 
effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the 
Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings. Leave 
the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and 
sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together 
again. When people respect each and care for each other as a 
community-organism...Spread the Peace!"

Come share another evening of unity through music and dance
with San Francisco's oldest house family.


Love,

Apollo






Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"I know what the great cure is:  it is to give up, to relinquish, to 
surrender, so that our little hearts may beat in unison with the great 
heart of the world."
-Henry Miller

"Loyalty is the realization that America was born of revolt, flourished in 
dissent, became great through experimentation. Our tradition is one of 
protest and revolt, and it is stultifying to celebrate the rebels of the 
past while we silence the rebels of the present."
-Henry Steele Commager

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Lungs bleeding of smoking

I know I know.  If only it were that easy.  I've tried to quit 6 times
now but keep coming back.  I think for me to pretty  much quit I'd have
to be away from society, news, alcohol etc for at least a year to fully
quit and want to stay quit.  My grandma died of lung cancer and I
couldn't even quit then although that was my longest attempt.  People
say (especially ex smokers who've quit cold turkey) that its so easy to
quit, just do it.  Well, unless your able to devote your mind fully to
it without other distractors getting in the way then its almost
impossble.  I suffer from chronic pain and migraines and most of the
time I'm completely out of it because my body shuts most of itself down
to deal with the pain.  Its almost cost me my jobs a few times much less
being able to concentrate enough to say 'No, I don't want another
cigarette.'  I wish there was a gene therapy treatment somewhat like
Clockwork Orange that took the choice away from me whether I want to
smoke or not.

-Rayn

>From Yale, one of the leading medical schools:
http://www.yale.edu/uhs/departments/health_ed/fooled.htm

Clove Cigarettes
	They contain twice as much tar and two to three times as much
nicotine as all-tobacco cigarettes.
	The anesthetic character of cloves leaves clove smokers
susceptible to many serious respiratory problems including infections,
pneumonia, difficulty breathing, and bleeding from the lungs.
	These symptoms, unlike those associated with nicotine intake,
can occur after one incident of clove smoking.


>From http://www.colostate.edu/Depts/HHS/APresDrugsTobacco.htm#a2

"...Are Clove cigarettes worse for you than regular cigarettes?

Clove cigarettes can be deadlier than cigarettes. This "natural" tobacco
does not have anything to do with being healthier. Often times the clove
cigarettes contain higher concentrations of tar and nicotine and the
smoke has greater levels of toxic agents such as carbon monoxide,
hydrogen cyanide, ammonia and carcinogenic hydrocarbons. Smokers of
clove cigarettes also have increased risk of emphysema, heart disease
and cancer of the mouth, lungs and throat. The anesthetic character of
clove leaves the smokers susceptible to many serious respiratory
problems including infections, pneumonia, difficulty breathing and
bleeding of the lungs. These symptoms, unlike those associated with
nicotine intake, can occur after one incident of clove smoking. One more
thing to remember is that most clove cigarettes don't have a filter so
you get the "full effect" of those chemicals! Bottom Line: There is no
SAFE cigarette!"

"...The active ingredient in cloves is a chemical called eugenol, which
is a potent topical anesthetic. There have been a few cases of
inflammation of the lungs with clove cigarettes, and any inhalation of
substances will have an impact on lung airways-which can cause
irritation, spasm, and coughing. It can definitely be more dangerous if
a person has asthma."

Good luck and whatever you decide, here's to better health and
happiness,

Karina

**************************************************************
******************>karina@hyperreal.org<********************** If there
is a sin against life, it consists perhaps not so much in despairing of
life as in hoping for another life & in eluding the implacable grandeur
of this life. -- Albert Camus --
*******************************************

Subject: [sfraves] may 31 show our strength





you all know about this?

May 12, 2003


DANCEmusic Presents
Show Our Strength: Freedom To Dance 2
To Showcase the Unity of the Electronic Music Scene
May 31st at the Westwood Federal Building,
Concurrent Events Scheduled For NYC, DC and Seattle


Los Angeles, CA - Recently formed electronic music activist group the Dance
And Nightlife Coalition of Electronic Music, a.k.a. DANCEmusic, presents
Show Our Strength: Freedom To Dance 2 at the Westwood Federal Building,
11000 Wilshire Blvd. on Saturday May 31st from 1pm - 8pm. This free event
will feature LA's top DJs, speeches by members of the electronic dance
music community and other progressive groups, and tabling from a variety of
activist organizations. A consortium of artists, promoters, organizations,
vendors and other members of the electronic music community are sponsoring
the event.


Show Our Strength: Freedom To Dance 2 is a rally to showcase the unity and
power of the Electronic Music Community to our political leaders in
Washington and locally. We will take this time to share with the larger
community the concerns of our scene in this pivotal moment in US history.
We will demonstrate that we are organized, dedicated, active, Americans who
will not stand for the trampling of the civil rights of our vibrant and
creative community, under laws like the RAVE Act or similar future
incursions. Groups in New York City, Washington DC and Seattle are also
participating by holding their own events in this showcase of the strength
and positivity of the electronic music community.


The following DJs are confirmed for the event: Richard "Humpty" Vission
(Powertools - 105.9 FM), Deepsky (Kinetic Records/LA), DJ Motiv8 (Black
Eyed Peas), Liza Richardson (KCRW), Steve Loria (ICU Media), and Machete
(Respect/Junglist Platoon).


Organizations who are actively using electronic music as a platform for
social and political change will be tabling. DanceSafe (www.dancesafe.org),
EMDEF - the Electronic Music Defense and Education Fund (www.emdef.org),
NextAid (www.nextaid.org), the American Civil Liberties Union,
(www.aclu.org), Dance For Peace, Rock The Vote (www.rockthevote.org) and
others will be distributing info, signing people up for their mailing
lists, registering voters and more.


Additionally there will be a variety of speakers including Francis
DellaVecchia (DANCEmusic, former LA Mayoral candidate), promoters from
B3Cande, Rock The Vote's Executive Director Jehmu Greene, representatives
from DanceSafe and more to be confirmed.


The Los Angeles group who organized the successful Freedom To Dance event
last September, attended by over 600 people and all the local news media,
formed DANCEmusic in the wake of the RAVE Act. In coalition with groups in
New York City (Blakkat, the ACLU Drug Policy Litigation Project) Washington
DC (Ravers Against The Rave Act, BuzzLife, the Drug Policy Alliance),
Seattle (Northwest Late Night Coalition), and San Francisco (San Francisco
Late Nigh Coalition) the RAVE Act was defeated. Over 40,000 petitions were
sent to Senators and even more calls, emails and faxes were received on
Capitol Hill.


Unfortunately in recent weeks the RAVE Act's sponsor Senator Joe Biden
(D-DE) was able to sneak provisions of the RAVE Act into the popular AMBER
Alert Bill. Senator Biden, has angrily deplored the fact that his bill
faced "fierce resistance." Senator Leahy, one of two original co-sponsors
of the RAVE Act admits that the electronic music scene helped turn the tide
against the bill and told reporters the RAVE Act faced "serious grass-roots
opposition."


DANCEmusic is devoted to introducing and reinforcing the positive aspects
of electronic music culture to the community at large. We strive foremost
to protect our civil liberties in the wake of misdirected government
attack. We will work through the legislative process, litigation, and
direct action to promote the best elements of the electronic music
experience, including freedom to assemble and freedom of expression. We aim
to educate and mobilize a community united through electronic dance music,
and to broaden and deepen the political awareness of a new generation, so
that they may grow into a true voice in American politics. We will rally in
defense of our culture!


We look forward to a beautiful day of music and action on the lawn of the
Federal Building on Saturday May 31st.


---------------------------------------------------------------------

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

> "...Are Clove cigarettes worse for you than regular
> cigarettes?
> 
> Clove cigarettes can be deadlier than cigarettes.
> This "natural" tobacco
> does not have anything to do with being healthier.
> Often times the clove
> cigarettes contain higher concentrations of tar and
> nicotine and the
> smoke has greater levels of toxic agents such as
> carbon monoxide,
> hydrogen cyanide, ammonia and carcinogenic
> hydrocarbons. Smokers of
> clove cigarettes also have increased risk of
> emphysema, heart disease
> and cancer of the mouth, lungs and throat. The
> anesthetic character of
> clove leaves the smokers susceptible to many serious
> respiratory
> problems including infections, pneumonia, difficulty
> breathing and
> bleeding of the lungs. These symptoms, unlike those
> associated with
> nicotine intake, can occur after one incident of
> clove smoking. One more
> thing to remember is that most clove cigarettes
> don't have a filter so
> you get the "full effect" of those chemicals! Bottom
> Line: There is no
> SAFE cigarette!"

> can cause

Subject: Re: [sfraves] after sex cigarettes nrr

Geri Dahl wrote:
 > you don't need to smoke after a good lay. a lot of people do that. they 
have sex, fabulous sex, and then they immediately light up a cigarette 
afterwards. in my humble opinion, if you are feeling aggitated enough to light 
up after the big bang, maybe you actually have enough energy for another go. 
don't lie. be real. someone like me always wants another go. someone like me 
can't stand just laying there quietly, wide awake, going..."oh, 
hmmmmmmmmmmmmm, i wonder if it is okay to move now. why can't we have another 
go?"...just do it! :)

ok! can i get sloppy seconds?

PS: IMHO, if the guy you're with lights up a cigarette after sex, it is his 
way of saying there's no way in hell your getting "another go" because
cigarettes tend to go hand-in-hand (or rather gland-in-hand) with inability
to achieve erection, or maintain a substantial and non-boopy erection.
My advice to you is find a better lay, or bring more batteries for the 
Panasonic. The guy sounds like a total asshole. But then
again, you always go for total assholes, and then complain about them on
sfraves. I think you like torturing yourself with dolts, then giving guys in
general a  bad rap and a bad rep (trolling). You just need to find yourself an
appropriately undersexed computer geek and they'll probably be happy to stay
up all night with 99.99999% uptime.

PPS: yeah that's right you heard it here first.... "computer geeks are longer
and harder than the transatlantic cable and can keep it up to the 5 nines!"

That was the first Come/Unity malachy benefit party, which was epic, IMHO.
I guess that was about a decade ago now.

Although whatever was moving in the damn portapottie hole sure was scary back
then. I was so young, I prolly still believed in monsters!

I still have the Tapes somewhere. My girlfriend at the time drew one of the
tape covers that was sold with the benefit tape set, and I remember drawing 
little sketches of what turntables, soundsystem speakers, etc looked like for
her, cuz I'm a geek. :-) Heh... and then there's that one tape of Jeno, I
think it's on this collection where he was spinning, I swear, breakbeat. :-)

The more things change, the more they stay the same. (Yeah I could do it in
french, but then i'd be a snotty effete wanker, noh?)

PS: Do I dare eat a peach?

>> Henry J. Kaiser, kinda sorta. Dual-level civic center, balcony seating, a
>> very wide hallway that runs the perimiter (good enough for a 2nd area,
>> social space), a few small side rooms. Fits 4-5000 comfortably, good lord
>> if they try to put much more in there.
>>
>> Gatherings, FTT's Le theater de futur, Area 51's....great memories =)
>>
>> ...not sure how the venue will be now with the scene's "tainted" status.
>> As I remember the venue was lost after an Area 51 due to a combination of
>> tagging, OD's, and residential complaints....I think.
>>
>> -terry

X-Mailer: Open WebMail 1.81 20021203
X-OriginatingIP: 205.94.32.21 (fog@www.deepfog.com)
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) Quote of the Day (Wed)

Here's for you perl freaks ... 



--

#!/usr/local/bin/perl 

# Generates two Zappa quotes. 
# One small one for inclusion on the homepage and one with context for
# the Quote page.
#
# Robbert Heederik, heederik@fwi.uva.nl, 16 April 1995

# chdir "/home/heederik/public_html/zappa/quote";

srand(time() % $$);

# &display_fortune('phrases',1024,'quote.inc','info.inc');
# &display_fortune('phrases',4,'small.inc','none');

# only to standard output (-)
&display_fortune('phrases',1024,'-','-');

sub display_fortune {
    local($fortunefile,$maxlines,$output,$output2) = @_;
    local($count,$pick,$number,$info);
    local(@quote,@info);

    open(INPUT, $fortunefile) || die "Couldn't open '$fortunefile': $!\n";

    # count fortunes
    while (<INPUT>) { $count++ if (/^%%$/); }

    # rewind
    seek(INPUT, 0, 0);

    # pick random fortune
    $pick = rand($count) + 1;

    #printf("get number %d from %d fortunes\n", $pick, $count);

    $number = 1;
    while (<INPUT>) { last if (/^%%$/ && ++$number >= $pick); }

    # get quote
    while (<INPUT>) {
	last if (/^%%$/);
	if (/^--$/) { $info = 1; last; }
	push(@quote, $_);
    }

    # get info
    while (<INPUT>) {
	last if (! defined($info));
	last if (/^%%$/);
	push(@info, $_);
    }

    if ($#quote >= $maxlines) {
	return &display_fortune(@_);
    }

    open(OUTPUT, ">$output") || die "Couldn't write to '$output': $!\n";
    for(@quote) { print OUTPUT; }
    close(OUTPUT);

    if ($output2 ne 'none') {
	open(OUTPUT, ">$output2") || die "Couldn't write to '$output2': $!\n";
	for(@info) { print OUTPUT; }
	close(OUTPUT);
    }
}



---------------------------------------------------------------------
To unsubscribe, e-mail: sfraves-unsubscribe@hyperreal.org
For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

----------------

The Matrix Revolutions

GENRE:  SciFi

MPAA RATING:  (NR),

RUN TIME:

RELEASE DATE  11/5/2003

STARRING:  Keanu Reeves, Carrie-Anne Moss, Laurence Fishburne, Hugo Weaving,
Jada Pinkett-Smith

DIRECTOR(S):  Larry Wachowski, Andy Wachowski

PRODUCER(S):  Joel Silver

WRITER(S):  Larry Wachowski, Andy Wachowski



   MOVIE SYNOPSIS


 In this third installment that concerns itself with death, Neo, Trinity,
and Morpheus--along with the rest of their battling posse--continue to come
against the machines that have systematically enslaved the human race in the
Matrix. Now displaying a greater confidence in his own power, Neo fully
realizes that he is a superhuman figure capable of amazing feats, and is
totally aware that he's able to see the codes of people and things with
which he comes into contact. Simultaneously more humans, who are struggling
to live in the real world, have awoken out of the Matrix. As their numbers
increase, the machines invade Zion, the center of human
resistance--considered the last real-world city.

From sfraves-return-102302-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Wed May 21 17:45:53 2003
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-102302-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>
Delivered-To: sfraves-archive@hyperreal.org

Received: (qmail 67876 invoked from network); 21 May 2003 17:45:52 -0000
X-Originating-IP: [206.169.32.152]
X-Originating-Email: [innocentchild@hotmail.com]
From: "innocentchild" <innocentchild@hotmail.com>
To: "_ fable _" <fable4our@hotmail.com>,
	<sfraves@hyperreal.org>
References: <Law11-F77ccKmemLQfX0003c278@hotmail.com>
Date: Wed, 21 May 2003 10:45:49 -0700
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Priority: 3
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1106
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1106
Message-ID: <Law8-OE37YibV2U5fn000006baf@hotmail.com>
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 21 May 2003 17:45:50.0749 (UTC) FILETIME=[D19E24D0:01C31FC0]
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves]Promoters and Biz minded peopleNRR

Harder than you think...

Given that I helped with Ascension @ Blakes for a while I got to hear about
all the problems. Ascension while it was still a Wed night event was able to
go until 3 or 4 in the morning. That was until some drunk guy jumped a
bouncer and the cops came. Now the Berkeley PD was keeping an eye on things.
They didn't like seeing a bunch of 18yo's in candy hanging out front all
night. To them that fashion equated to drugs. More pressure placed on the
event. I came in at this point and worked to change the format and target
and older, non-candy market. That was a direct request of the owner who was
getting hassled by the police. Everything went great with the new format and
we repeatedly sold out thrusday nights at Blakes. Hell we went over capacity
several times. At this point things were still 18+ which was great, but in
itself caused problems. The night was popular and there was a lot of
underage drinking going on. That's a threat to a liquor license which is
something as a bar/club owner you don't want messed with. Then there is this
thing with insurance. To insure an 18+ venue *with* a bar costs you tens of
thousands of dollars more a year. Liability is a bitch. Blake's discovered
that they didn't have the insurance to be 18+ and had to switch back to 21+
like they had been prior to a few years ago. That move in conjunction with
some other internal problems led to the demise of Ascension. Blake's
realized that this really hurt business and has since taken the steps to get
the insurance needed to be 18+ again.

Liquor license, food permits, music permits and so on are all required. It's
not easy and it can get damn painful depending on where you're located. Some
areas won't issue any new liquor licenses either. The only way to get one is
to take over an existing establishment that is already permitted. It's a
crazy business and a lot of work...

(oh and no, Ascension isn't coming back to my knowledge even with Blakes
being 18+)

ryan.bailey
sninesix.design
design :: www.sninesix.com
photography :: www.innocentchild.com

Subject: RE: [sfraves] Lungs bleeding of smoking

--0-359326309-1053546945=:20694
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

If you are desparate enough to try Clockwork Orange style gene therapy, you have a lot more options than "just quitting". Like any addiction, a few people can "just Quit" but *most* people can't, If you really want to quit, Hypnosis works, but it takes some effort and you have to be dedicated enough to keep going and go back when you relapse. You also might want to talk to a doctor about using an antidepressant like wellbutrin in combination with behavioral therapy, since ciggarete addiction is a chemical dependancy a lot of smokers need to regulate their saratonin artificaly for a while, so they stop associating the saratonin with the nicotine.  Behavioral therapy works a lot like hypnosis does, you have to keep doing it. It may sound expensive, but it's your body, and ciggarettes aren't cheap. I have also heard that Quitting smoking takes 7 to 10 attempts to be successfull for most people. If you want to change anything about yourself you have to have a concrete plan and falesafes, and plan on failing a few times, like me trying to lower my damn cholesterol...I MISS REAL CHEESE! so I keep my house full of berries, as a reward for not eating junk food. 
 
 
 
 
"I know I know.  If only it were that easy.  I've tried to quit 6 times
now but keep coming back.  I think for me to pretty  much quit I'd have
to be away from society, news, alcohol etc for at least a year to fully
quit and want to stay quit.  My grandma died of lung cancer and I
couldn't even quit then although that was my longest attempt.  People
say (especially ex smokers who've quit cold turkey) that its so easy to
quit, just do it.  Well, unless your able to devote your mind fully to
it without other distractors getting in the way then its almost
impossble.  I suffer from chronic pain and migraines and most of the
time I'm completely out of it because my body shuts most of itself down
to deal with the pain.  Its almost cost me my jobs a few times much 
less
being able to concentrate enough to say 'No, I don't want another
cigarette.'  I wish there was a gene therapy treatment somewhat like
Clockwork Orange that took the choice away from me whether I want to
smoke or not."

-Rayn





--
Sarah Schumm <sarah_schumm@yahoo.com>
Hypnobunny Creative Services - Posters, Logos, Ads and More

FYI...his name is Mike Skinner of the Streets....some call him Mike Streets. These kats are hot right now and are appearing at Every major festival around the World. 
 
They just played at Coachella 03' and will be performing at the Field Day Festival in NYC June 6 & 7. (www.fielddayfestival.com)
 
 The Streets just recently Played for COOLWORLD @ the 5th Annual ULTRA Music Festival in Miami during the Winter Music Conference.
 
 Needless to say they tore the roof off the place and then some. Coolworld is going to be bringing them out west soon as well.
 
 For more info on "The Streets" check out there home page 
--> http://www.the-streets.co.uk/
 
 
 
COOLWORLD

>From the creators of METROPOLIS...

Clockwork invites you to join us, as we ignite the long anticipated 5TH 
ANNUAL

ATLANTiS 2003 
An Aquatic Underworld Beyond Your Imagination 
Saturday JULY 19th, 2003


* Richmond Civic Auditorium 403 Richmond Civic Center Plza, Richmond, CA
* 8 Hours of Musical Mayhem (6PM-2AM )
* 4 Boomin' Dance Arenas
* Featuring the Illest International &Local DJ's, on the Planet&
* Exotic GoGo Dancers,
* Theatrical Stage designs by: ArtVark/Clockwork
* Amazing Earth Circus Performers, 
* Friendly and Helpful Security, 
* Tribal drum circles, Eco-conscious booths, Tribal Faire with tattoos and 
body piercing, 
* Aromatherapy and massage, arts and crafts, carnival performers, CD Music 
giveaways all night long and many more surprises



::AREA 1::
TEMPLE OF BOOM
(FunkyHouse/TechHouse):
Rulers Of Atlantis, Bring The Noize!!!
MC/Congas: Alex C. Olmedo

JUNiOR SANCHEZ ...West Coast Massive Debut (cube/armed/chi)
DONALD GLAUDE (moonshine/donaldglaude.com/seattle)

RICK V.(inthamix/sac)
HUEY (yerba buena discos/sf)



::AREA 2::

(Trance/Progressive)
Taking you on a mystical Journey!!!

DEEPSKY ( kinetic records/la)

::AREA 3::
AQUATIC JUNGLE
(Jungle/HipHop/Turntablism)
Witness as these purists shred the turntables, and Drop that Bass!!!
Hosted by: MC DUH (groundscore/sf)

DJ CRAZE.... World DMC Champion / DMC World Team Champion 
(allies/the-allies.com/djcraze.com/contagiusmusiq/miami)
DANNY THA WiLDCHILD (chicagojunglist/fullysorted/chicago)

ADAM SANTANA



Always, PLURified peeps, Cultureized beats, Positive Vibes and Collective 
Tribes. The events we envision can only be possible because of your support. And 
because of you, we have collectively made a stance to keep the electronic 
music scene alive today. We are only one part in a growing Phenomenon of Music and 
Dance that is forever getting stronger, more artistic and culturally diverse. 
Please remember that this is your party, your music, your scene. Be 
Responsible and Dance till the sun comes up.

BUY PRESALE!! THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT!!! Buy your tickets early, Save Green, 
and secure you and your friends guaranteed entry inside Atlantis.

Buy only from listed outlets, beware of forgeries!

Pre-Sale Tickets go on sale May 23rd, 2003.
Limited Pre-sale Tickets for $25.
Once those Sell Out, Tickets will then be $30. 
Once those Sell Out, Tickets will then be $35. 

BUY TICKETS ONLINE
Tickets also available @ <A HREF="http://www.groovetickets.com/">www.GrooveTickets.com</A>
Online Ticket Holders will be granted exclusive line access for easy entry.

In yet another heavy-handed attempt by the government to squash opposing 
points of view, legislation before the House of Representatives would allow 
the nation's drug czar to use taxpayer dollars to oppose political 
candidates or ballot initiatives that support the legalization of medical 
marijuana.


Medical marijuana has significant medical benefits and is supported by the 
majority of the public.  We need to stop the federal assault on medical 
marijuana initiatives!


Click here for more information and to send a free fax to your Member of 
Congress!

X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] News; "We may be the headache, but we're not the tumour"

CN AB: Linking Drugs To Events Is Unfair, Says Rave Community
URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n732/a13.html
Newshawk: Join CMAP (http://www.mapinc.org/cmap/lists.htm)
Pubdate: Thu, 15 May 2003
Source: FFWD (CN AB)
Copyright: 2003 FFWD
Contact: info@ffwd.greatwest.ca
Website: http://www.greatwest.ca/ffwd/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/1194
Author: Tom Babin

LINKING DRUGS TO EVENTS IS UNFAIR, SAYS RAVE COMMUNITY

Members of Calgary's rave community say they feel attacked and pigeonholed
by police and media reports about drug use at raves.

A nine-month sting operation targeted at the city's rave scene was
recently touted by police for a number of drug arrests and netting drugs
like ecstasy and ketamine.  Repeated phone calls to police requesting
comment on the operation were not returned.

Members of Calgary's rave community say linking drug use to raves is
unfair, especially because many feel a true rave scene has been stifled in
Calgary under the controversial extended dance bylaw -- much-anticipated
changes to the bylaw are still being developed.

Lucie Vlach, a member of a dance community organization who is working
with city hall on changes to the bylaw, says she was surprised by the news
of the drug busts because the bylaw has resulted in very few raves taking
place in Calgary.

She adds that the bylaw's requirement that promoters pay for off-duty
police officers to patrol raves is among the more contentious aspects of
the bylaw because that expense is too much for many promoters.  Such
expenses mean most promoters can only stage small, unlicensed events.

Vlach says the dance community has been pushing for changes to those
requirements, and she questions police motivations for targeting raves.

"I'm speculating, but maybe we're seeing all this in the media for police
to justify their presence at events," she says.  "I think some of this is
to show that ( police ) presence is needed."

Craig Booone, another member of Calgary's dance community, says he is
getting tired of the scene being labelled as a drug haven because drugs
are no more prevalent at raves than at schools and nightclubs, where busts
are rarely front-page news.

"If it was a Rod Stewart concert where everybody was smoking pot, you
wouldn't hear about it," Boone says.  "The police nick one or two dealers,
well, you're talking about one per cent of the community.  You can't hold
the other 99 per cent accountable for that.

"As far as the community is concerned, it's good riddance -- nobody wants
dealers around raves."

Vlach says it's wrong to assume that raves are a hotbed of drug activity,
and that such stereotypes further sully the reputation of those struggling
to make positive changes to the bylaw and create a true community.

"We may be the headache, but we're not the tumour.  We're getting easily
blamed because we're a small community," Vlach says.

"Rave culture and club culture and drug culture are not the same thing.
We're not the cause of the problem."

Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
X-Spam-Rating: localhost 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] News: Drug War Addiction


US CA: OPED: Drug War Addiction
URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v03/n676/a04.html
Newshawk: Kirk Muse
Webpage: http://www.sierratimes.com/03/05/07/guestoped_ea.htm
Pubdate: Wed, 07 May 2003
Source: Sierra Times (US Web)
Copyright: 2003, The Sierra Times
Contact: editor@sierratimes.com
Website: http://www.sierratimes.com/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/2838
Author: Emiliano Antunez
Note: MAP posted as an exception to MAP's web source posting policies.

DRUG WAR ADDICTION

Just when you thought it was safe to turn on the boob tube, the Office of
National Drug Policy starts a new TV ad campaign.  The previous campaign
attempted to tie drug use to terrorism.  Among the more sinister ads was
one where an apparition of a dead girl tells a woman working in an office,
"you killed me," implying she died in a terrorist attack due to the
woman's "illegal" drug consumption.  Using the government's logic, not
only are all drug users aiding and abetting terrorist, they're murderers
too.  The latest ad campaign takes aim at internal dissenters and critics
of the drug war.  It features two men talking, one of them saying simply
to legalize drugs.  The response is, "so you want drugs sold to kids on
playgrounds.....," to which the original speaker says, "I guess it's not
such a good idea." To attempt to discuss the 30+ year drug war in a 30
second snippet is a serious attempt to insult most Americans intelligence.

The ad campaign does prove that, not only do bureaucrats and politicians
not get out much, but they also have too much time and money on their
hands.  These ads cost hundreds of millions of tax dollars to produce and
air, yet by the Office of National Drug policy's own admission, have
little if any effect on drug consumption.

Unlike the governments ads, lets seriously consider some of the causes and
effects of the drug war.  The first assumption made by the drug warriors
is that legalization will bring drugs onto our nations playgrounds.  If
the folks at the National Drug Policy Office would leave the office more
often, or venture out of the confines of their gated suburban
neighborhoods, they would see that drugs are not only being sold on
playgrounds already, but near schools as well.  Most of this happens in
lower income areas which crosses racial lines and is based purely on
economic and political conditions.  Naturally, the people living in these
areas have little if any political or economic clout.  Add to that the
facts that too many of the people living in these areas are on some sort
of government assistance, and sometimes view children as an added
government check, and you have the main ingredients for disaster.  This
attracts thugs seeking the high profits made possible by the "illegal"
status placed on these drugs by the government.  These thugs usually take
over corners, buildings and even whole streets making life much more
dangerous and difficult for law abiding citizens who have to live and work
in these areas.

The death and violence that accompanies the drug trade are due mainly to
the fact that drugs are illegal.  Young people are enticed away from entry
level jobs, with the lure of making thousands of dollars a week in illegal
drug trafficking.  Of course all this money will attract competition,
causing drive by shootings and other forms of deadly violence.  The
profits are so astronomical that even the possibility of death can't deter
those with criminal inclinations seeking a quick and "easy" buck.

The ads imply that those buying drugs are helping fund criminal
enterprises and, therefore, directly responsible for terrorism and murder.
If that ain't the pot calling the kettle black! The truth is that the only
thing keeping "illegal" drug prices and profits artificially high, is the
government's war on drugs.  The reason that criminal gangs and terrorists
around the globe profit from illegal drug sales is strictly because they
are illegal.  Those buying drugs in the inner city are no more responsible
for funding terrorism than those pumping gas at the local gas station.

Contrary to popular perceptions, drug use and addiction are not confined
to the poverty stricken.  Many of the customers of the inner city drug
traffickers are college age suburbanites, and sometimes even their
professionally employed parents.  Most of the individuals that purchase
drugs do not commit violent crimes, yet are susceptible to fines and
prison terms if caught possessing an "illegal" substance.  This, of
course, leads to overcrowded conditions in jails, too often allowing for
early release of violent criminals.

So, why would the government continue to pursue a policy for decades that
actually increases drug use and violence? To put it as succinctly as
possible, money and power.  The truth is that the drug war has created
huge bureaucracies hooked on tax dollars that fund their existence.  These
bureaucracies successes are not measured in the reduction of drug use, but
rather on the amount of money they spend and the number of arrests made.
In reality, they benefit more from an increase in drug use than from a
decrease.  They are just as addicted to taxpayer dollars, as street corner
drug dealers are to quick and easy drug profits or a junkie to his heroin.
The existence of dealers, addicts and bureaucrats are mutually dependent.

Power is also an incentive for the government continuing its war.
Politicians have used the drug war as an excuse to trample the second,
fourth and fifth amendments to the constitution, while allowing law
enforcement officers to profit by circumventing due process ( Zero
Tolerance ).  The drug war has spawned laws that allows the government to
snoop into everyone's business dealings and bank transactions.  It has
allowed our governments influence and money to spread beyond our borders.
Today, drug agents and military personnel are involved in anti-drug
trafficking operations all over the globe, including Peru where a
missionary and her infant son where killed during a US sponsored
interdiction exercise.  If one counts the number of peasant farmers
terrorized by guerrilla groups funded by illegal drug profits, the
casualties of the war on drugs rise astronomically.

Will ending the drug war end the problem of drug abuse? Absolutely not.
Drugs that alter a human's state of consciousness have been around as long
as humans have.  Legalizing certain drugs does not equal moralizing their
use or making them healthy to consume.  Strangely enough, the majority of
drugs that alter consciousness and mental function are legal and even
advertised on TV and magazines.  There are many biological and social
factors that lead to a person's desire for, or addiction to certain drugs.
History has shown time and again that all the laws in the world, or all
the law enforcement officers on this planet can not curtail some people's
appetite for drugs or money.

Will making drugs more available cause more use and or overdoses? No one
knows for sure, but ending prohibition did not cause any measurable rise
in alcoholism.  If anything it made it easier for all those who felt they
had a problem to seek treatment without fear of legal repercussions.  It
also ended the violence between bootleggers and gangsters that sought to
control the illegal flow of booze.  Who will be more vigilant of the
quality of his product and the customers survivability, a legitimate
business that can be sued or a faceless thug standing on a corner?

Speaking of prohibition, at least those that favored it were responsible
enough to follow the letter of the law by adding an amendment to the
constitution ( 18th Amendment ).  Fortunately, it was later repealed (
21st Amendment ).  Today's drug warriors have chosen to violate and
circumvent the constitution, sacrificing our rights in the interim.  Much
like ending prohibition, ending the war on drugs will vaporize profits for
criminals, ending most drug related violence and help to put an end to the
infringement of our constitutional rights.  Who knows? It may even get
drugs off our streets, out of the playground, and away from our schools.

( Editor's note: The author of this piece seems to have forgotten another
powerful incentive for government to continue the "war on [some] drugs
indefinitely.  They have given themselves the power to confiscate the
personal property of whomever they wish, even on very thin pretext of
involvement with drugs, often with no charges ever being made and
certainly not depending on any conviction of actual criminal activity.
This, along with the vast amounts of taxpayer money, makes the drug trade
extremely profitable for all levels of the government and they will do
murder and worse to prevent anything from challenging or changing this
situation.  The sad part is that the people of this country have been
hoodwinked into letting them get away with it.  Sad.  Susan Callaway,
Editor )

Pre-Concert Talk, Trocadero Clubhouse

August 10 Que Movida! CUBANISMO! Sidestepper

August 17 Platinum Jazz WAR The Headhunters OUTREACH EVENTS KIDS  DAYS 
Treemonisha for Kids Thursday,

June 19, 11:00 a.m. African American Art and Culture Complex, 762 Fulton 
Street, San Francisco Friday,  June 20, 11:00 a.m. Bayview Opera House 4705 
3rd Street, San Francisco Hawaiian Culture Thursday,

June 26, 11:00 a.m. Stern Grove Friday, June 27, 11:00 a.m. Stern Grove 
African Playground Wednesday, July 30, 11:00 a.m. Stern Grove Presented in 
association with Putumayo World Music MUSICAL CONVERSATIONS Na Lei Hulu I Ka 
Wekiu Tuesday, June 24, 6:00 p.m. Community Music Center 544 Capp Street, San 
Francisco Willie K Saturday, June 28, 3:00 p.m. Community Music Center 544 
Capp Street, San Francisco

Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Beach/Area to stay in San Diego this weekend? ::
 help! ::

On Thu, 22 May 2003, innocentchild wrote:

> I'm heading to San Diego this weekend for a few days. What area is beach,
good mexican, bit of a nightlife, and has some lodging walking distance from
the prior? Basically - park at hotel, then walk from there and get drink on,
food on, and sun on. Any help is appreciated!

Um, Mission Beach is good for Santa Cruz stylee Beach/Boardwalk type
stuff. Mexican is everywhere. Hillcrest has some good spots. But downtown
is where the majority of the nightlife is, so take your pick. Throw a
fifth in a big gulp and hire one of those bike-carts, and cruise the
clubs to get your drunk on.

Better yet, just contact Rodrigo <rod@viberation.com>, he'll hook you up
proper =)

> Terry?? HAve you left for Oregon yet?? Help!

Almost, car half-packed, camping gear in order, getting brakes done. Then
it's off to RAVE THE FUCK ON this weekend!! hehe.

-terry

terry estioko | terry@viberation.com
http://www.estioko.com

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  Come-Unity Twelfth Anniversary Friday!!!!

--=====================_2097643==_.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic, 
tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of 
years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal 
music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same beat, 
between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people 
shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and psychedelic 
alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're going 
back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and 
visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.

Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)


COME-UNITY:  Twelfth Anniversary Party

WHEN: THIS FRIDAY, MAY 23RD

WHERE: MEZZANINE, 444 Jessie Street @ 5th, San Francisco

On the turntables:

Mark Farina (OM Records)

Jeno (Wicked)

Simon (Come-Unity; Future Dreams)

Cosmik Jason (Imperial Dub; Come-Unity)

DJ Adnan (Tarantic; PR2) with Drum Fire (aFRO mYSTIK; OM Records)

10:30pm - 6:30am, $10 before 11 PM, $15 thereafter, 21+



MALACHY ON HOUSE

"When used with positive intention, Group energy has the potential to help 
restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the 
whole group you dance with; when you feel love with everyone, and they 
return it, a higher vibration can be reached. This happens when a crowd is 
deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the 
effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the 
Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings. Leave 
the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and 
sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together 
again. When people respect each and care for each other as a 
community-organism...Spread the Peace!"

Come share another evening of unity through music and dance
with San Francisco's oldest house family.


Love,

Apollo






Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"I know what the great cure is:  it is to give up, to relinquish, to 
surrender, so that our little hearts may beat in unison with the great 
heart of the world."
-Henry Miller

"Loyalty is the realization that America was born of revolt, flourished in 
dissent, became great through experimentation. Our tradition is one of 
protest and revolt, and it is stultifying to celebrate the rebels of the 
past while we silence the rebels of the present."
-Henry Steele Commager




--=====================_2097643==_.ALT--

Seemed like Wicked had a problem where the Wicked faithful got stuck outside
waiting in a horrendous line while the joe schmoe's packed the place. I
really hope that the Come-Unity family gets there early, fills the place and
truly sets the tone for the night. That might sound a tad elitist, but it's
not meant to be. Wicked felt a bit off in the vibe the crowd gave off. It
wasn't what I normally expected from a Wicked party. Hoping for a better
feeling this time around (and hopefully some better performance from the
dj's!).

Like last time Andrew Phelan will be having a warmup session at his house (1
block away from the club). It would be great to get a group together early
and head over together. =)

Subject: [sfraves] festival in monterey this weekend (bsp/nrr)

i realize it's a bit of a trek for most sfravers, but
for anyone who might be interested, there is a
festival taking place in downtown monterey this
weekend, may 24 & 25, from 11am to 6pm.

the festival features free admission, live bands
(rock, blues, latin, jazz, etc) and other
entertainment, international food booths, arts &
crafts vendors, fun-for-the-whole-family! etc etc. 
and last but not least, i will be there both days
giving handwriting analyses for $15 each and tarot
readings for $5.

so, if anyone is interested in getting a handwriting
analysis or tarot reading from me in person, make a
printout of this email to bring with you and i will
give you half off.

hope to see you there!

mission beach rules!!!!!!!!!!!!!! you can stay right on the water and brunch outdoors in the morning...just cab it to the city center and back if you don't know where you are. whole lotta rasta around there too, so it's real mellow. :)

Terry Estioko <terry@saturn5.com> wrote:On Thu, 22 May 2003, innocentchild wrote:

> I'm heading to San Diego this weekend for a few days. What area is beach,
good mexican, bit of a nightlife, and has some lodging walking distance from
the prior? Basically - park at hotel, then walk from there and get drink on,
food on, and sun on. Any help is appreciated!

Um, Mission Beach is good for Santa Cruz stylee Beach/Boardwalk type
stuff. Mexican is everywhere. Hillcrest has some good spots. But downtown
is where the majority of the nightlife is, so take your pick. Throw a
fifth in a big gulp and hire one of those bike-carts, and cruise the
clubs to get your drunk on.

Better yet, just contact Rodrigo , he'll hook you up
proper =)

> Terry?? HAve you left for Oregon yet?? Help!

Almost, car half-packed, camping gear in order, getting brakes done. Then
it's off to RAVE THE FUCK ON this weekend!! hehe.

At 10:22 AM 5/22/2003 -0700, innocentchild wrote:
>Seemed like Wicked had a problem where the Wicked faithful got stuck outside
>waiting in a horrendous line while the joe schmoe's packed the place. I
>really hope that the Come-Unity family gets there early, fills the place and
>truly sets the tone for the night. That might sound a tad elitist, but it's
>not meant to be. Wicked felt a bit off in the vibe the crowd gave off. It
>wasn't what I normally expected from a Wicked party. Hoping for a better
>feeling this time around (and hopefully some better performance from the
>dj's!).

I personally stopped going to the Wicked club events after a terrible 
experience at the DNA.  My advice to them was, and is, to do presales.

As for Malachy's Come-Unity -- it's always difficult to predict who will 
show up at a club event.  The tenth anniversary party at Barneveld was an 
excellent time, even though I thought there were too many people inside -- 
but most of the folks were family.

I have high hopes for this party.  The last Come-Unity was in a year ago at 
King Street.  As you know, it was a monthly for eleven years.  CU was 
originally held on the first Wednesday of each month and that kept the 
party focused on the passionate house heads.  But times change, and the 
number of dancers able to party until five on a Wednesday night 
declined.  I used to negotiate with my employers to come in at noon on 
Thursdays, but the 24/7 economy in the late nineties killed the Wednesday 
nite deal.

So they moved to the first Friday of the month.  Results were mixed.  Some 
nights one had the family.  Other evenings it was clubbers who didn't care 
about the music.  On the whole, though, the CUs at Mission Rock were 
quality events.  From Malachy's perspective, however, the costs were so 
high there that he could barely make a profit.

For me, this party was a monthly family reunion.  There were people who 
came to this event for over a decade, as I did, and dancing with them over 
the years brought much happiness to me.   I expect that many of them will 
be there Friday.

I'll probably help with set up on Friday, go home, and then head in around 
twelve or so.  The party goes until 6:30 am, so if I don't like what's 
going down then I'll go over to Club 6 and come back later.

Love,

Apollo


>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
>To: "SFRaves@hyperreal. org" <SFRaves@hyperreal.org>

>Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Come-Unity Twelfth Anniversary Friday!!!!
>
>
>
>It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
>tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
>years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal
>music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same beat,
>between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
>shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and psychedelic
>alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're going
>back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
>visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.
>
>Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
>in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)
>
>
>COME-UNITY:  Twelfth Anniversary Party
>

>MALACHY ON HOUSE

>"When used with positive intention, Group energy has the potential to help
>restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the
>whole group you dance with; when you feel love with everyone, and they
>return it, a higher vibration can be reached. This happens when a crowd is
>deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the
>effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
>Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings. Leave
>the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
>sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
>again. When people respect each and care for each other as a
>community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
>
>Come share another evening of unity through music and dance
>with San Francisco's oldest house family.

Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"I know what the great cure is:  it is to give up, to relinquish, to 
surrender, so that our little hearts may beat in unison with the great 
heart of the world."
-Henry Miller

"Loyalty is the realization that America was born of revolt, flourished in 
dissent, became great through experimentation. Our tradition is one of 
protest and revolt, and it is stultifying to celebrate the rebels of the 
past while we silence the rebels of the present."
-Henry Steele Commager

> tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of

In a message dated 5/22/03 10:13:04 AM, apollo@speakeasy.org writes:


> It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
> tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
> years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal
> music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same beat,
> between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
> shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and psychedelic
> alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're going
> back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
> visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.
> 
> Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
> in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)
> 
> 
> COME-UNITY: Twelfth Anniversary Party
> 
> WHEN: THIS FRIDAY, MAY 23RD

> Mark Farina (OM Records)

> Jeno (Wicked)

> Simon (Come-Unity; Future Dreams)

> Cosmik Jason (Imperial Dub; Come-Unity)
> 
> DJ Adnan (Tarantic; PR2) with Drum Fire (aFRO mYSTIK; OM Records)
> 
> 10:30pm - 6:30am, $10 before 11 PM, $15 thereafter, 21+
> 
> 
> 
> MALACHY ON HOUSE
> 
> "When used with positive intention, Group energy has the potential to help
> restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust the
> whole group you dance with; when you feel love with everyone, and they
> return it, a higher vibration can be reached. This happens when a crowd is
> deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement, the
> effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
> Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings. Leave
> the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
> sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
> again. When people respect each and care for each other as a
> community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
> 
> Come share another evening of unity through music and dance
> with San Francisco's oldest house family.
> 
> 
> Love,
> 
> Apollo
> 





heart,
Alida

> In a message dated 5/22/03 10:13:04 AM, apollo@speakeasy.org writes:
> 
> 
> > It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
> > tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
> > years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal
> > music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same beat,
> > between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
> > shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and psychedelic
> > alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're going
> > back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
> > visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.
> > 
> > Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
> > in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)
> >

booth!!!!  Side note... this is not the annual Benifit "Ascension" =
happening... this is a fundraiser!!!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~`

This Saturday, come check out Be Here Now, a benefit fundraiser at =
StudioZ
in San Francisco. Be Here Now is a fundraiser supporting five causes:

	The American Civil Liberties Union Foundation of Northern California

	http://www.aclunc.org

	The Electronic Frontier Foundation
	http://www.eff.org

	The Nature Conservancy
	http://www.nature.org

	The San Francisco Late Night Coalition
	http://www.sflnc.com

	...And a Burning Man memorial project for Court Demas
	http://www.courtdemas.com

The benefit party will take place on Saturday, May 24, 2003 from 10pm to
8am at StudioZ in the SoMa district of San Francisco, California. Be =
Here
Now will feature the musical talents of some of the Bay Area's best DJs:

	Tony (The Gathering/Tango Recordings)
	Jen=F6 (Wicked)
	Simon (Come-Unity/Future Dreams)
	Preston (Stompy)
	Galen (Sunset/PacificSound)
	JZ (Red Melon)
	Mikey Riddler with Joonbug on guitar (OM Records/Unifying Souls)
	Fredness (Flavasauce)
	Freya (Hemisphere)

	...and a special surprise guest

Four-corner sound system installation provided by J=F6rgen and =
HeavySounds.


StudioZ (http://www.studioz.tv) is located at 314 11th Street (@ Folsom
Street).  For advance tickets ($10, 21+ w/ID) and more information,=20
go to:
http://www.beherenowsf.org.

All profits will go to the mentioned causes. All organizations will be =
on
site for those interested in donating directly or learning more about
their work. A number of massage therapists will be donating their time =
for
free massage throughout the evening. This will be a very special evening
to celebrate the life of Court Demas and his alrtuistic efforts.

I usually delete junk emails as well, but, this was too funny not to =
share ...
Jack Triumph

 Oil Change instructions for Women:
    Pull up to Jiffy Lube when the mileage reaches 3000 miles (or =
thereabouts :-) since the last oil change.=20

    Drink a cup of coffee.=20

    15 minutes later write a check and leave with a properly maintained =
vehicle.=20


Money spent:
Oil Change $30.00, Coffee $1.00=20

Total $31.00=20


Oil Change instructions for Men:

    Wait until Saturday, drive to auto parts store and buy a case of =
oil, filter, kitty litter, hand cleaner and a scented tree, write a =
check for $50.00.=20

    Stop by liquor store and buy a case of beer, write a check for =
$20.00, drive home.=20

    Open a beer and drink it.=20

    Spend 30 minutes looking for jack stands. Jack car up.=20

    Find jack stands under kid's pedal car.=20

    In frustration, open another beer and drink it.=20

    Place drain pan under engine.=20

    Look for 9/16 box end wrench.=20

    Give up and use crescent wrench.=20

    Drop drain plug in pan of hot oil: splash hot oil on face and arms =
in process. Cuss.=20

    Crawl out from under car to wipe hot oil off of face and arms. Throw =
kitty litter on spilled oil.=20

    Have another beer while watching oil drain.=20

    Spend 30 minutes looking for oil filter wrench.=20

    Give up; crawl under car and hammer a screwdriver through oil filter =
and twist off.=20

    Crawl out from under car with dripping oil filter splashing oil =
everywhere from holes. Cleverly hide old oil filter among trash in trash =
can to avoid environmental penalties.=20

    Drink a beer.=20

    Buddy shows up; finish case of beer with him. Decide to finish oil =
change tomorrow so you can go see his new garage door opener work.=20

    Sunday: Skip church because "I gotta finish the oil change." Drag =
pan full of told oil out from underneath car. Cleverly dump oil in hole =
in back yard instead of taking it to recycle.=20

    Throw kitty litter on oil spilled during step 18.=20

    Beer? No, drank it all yesterday.=20

    Walk to liquor store; buy beer.=20

    Install new oil filter making sure to apply a thin coat of oil to =
gasket surface.=20

    Dump first quart of fresh oil into engine.=20

    Remember drain plug from step 11.=20

    Hurry to find drain plug in drain pan.=20

    Remember that the used oil is buried in a hole in the back yard =
along with drain plug.=20

    Drink beer.=20

    Shovel out hole and sift oily mud for drain plug. Re-shovel oily =
patch of ground and avoid environmental penalties. Wash drain plug in =
lawnmower gas.=20

    Discover that first quart of fresh oil is now on the floor. Throw =
kitty litter on oil spill.=20

    Drink beer.=20

    Crawl under car getting kitty litter into eyes. Wipe eyes with oily =
rag used to clean drain plug. Slip with stupid crescent wrench =
tightening drain plug and bang knuckles on frame.=20

    Bang head on floorboards in reaction to step 31=20

    Begin cussing fit.=20

    Throw stupid crescent wrench.=20

    Cuss for additional 10 minutes because wrench hit Miss December =
(1992) in the left boob.=20

    Beer.=20

    Clean up hands and forehead and bandage as required to stop blood =
flow.=20

    Beer.=20

    Beer.=20

    Dump in five fresh quarts of oil.=20

    Beer.=20

    Lower car from jack stands.=20

    Accidentally crush remaining case of new motor oil.=20

    Move car back to apply more kitty litter to fresh oil spilled during =
steps 23-43.=20

    Beer.=20

    Test drive car.=20

    Get pulled over: arrested for driving under the influence.=20

    Car gets impounded.=20

    Call loving wife to come make your bail.=20

    12 hours later, get car from impound yard.=20


Money spent:
Parts $50.00, DUI $2500.00, Impound fee $75.00, Bail $1500.00, Beer =
$40.00
Total-- $4165.00 -- But you know the job was done right!=20



--

> > It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
> > tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
> > years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal
> > music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same
> beat,
> > between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
> > shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and
> psychedelic
> > alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're
> going
> > back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
> > visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.

> > In a message dated 5/22/03 10:13:04 AM, apollo@speakeasy.org writes:
> >
> >
> > > It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
> > > tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
> > > years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music,
>Aboriginal
> > > music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same
> > beat,
> > > between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
> > > shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and
> > psychedelic
> > > alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're
> > going
> > > back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
> > > visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.
> > >
> > > Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
> > > in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)
> > >
> > >
> > > COME-UNITY:  Twelfth Anniversary Party
> > >
> > > WHEN: THIS FRIDAY, MAY 23RD
> > >
> > > WHERE: MEZZANINE, 444 Jessie Street @ 5th, San Francisco
> > >
> > > On the turntables:
> > >
> > > Mark Farina (OM Records)
> > >
> > > Jeno (Wicked)
> > >
> > > Simon (Come-Unity; Future Dreams)
> > >
> > > Cosmik Jason (Imperial Dub; Come-Unity)
> > >
> > > DJ Adnan (Tarantic; PR2) with Drum Fire (aFRO mYSTIK; OM Records)
> > >
> > > 10:30pm - 6:30am, $10 before 11 PM, $15 thereafter, 21+
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > MALACHY ON HOUSE
> > >
> > > "When used with positive intention, Group energy has the potential to
> > help
> > > restore the plan of Love on Earth...When you open your heart, and trust
> > the
> > > whole group you dance with; when you feel love with everyone, and they
> > > return it, a higher vibration can be reached. This happens when a crowd
> > is
> > > deep into the vibe of House...In the true sense of rhythmic movement,
>the
> > > effect is to align the physical, mental and emotional bodies with the
> > > Oneness of All that Is...Don't put out negative energy and feelings.
> > Leave
> > > the old ways behind. Throw yourself into the winds of transformation and
> > > sow the seeds for a new world -- one where the human family is together
> > > again. When people respect each and care for each other as a
> > > community-organism...Spread the Peace!"
> > >
> > > Come share another evening of unity through music and dance
> > > with San Francisco's oldest house family.
> > >
> > >
> > > Love,
> > >
> > > Apollo

Moksha Tribe

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness.  It is 
not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a purpose."
-Helen Keller

"I know what the great cure is:  it is to give up, to relinquish, to 
surrender, so that our little hearts may beat in unison with the great 
heart of the world."
-Henry Miller

"Loyalty is the realization that America was born of revolt, flourished in 
dissent, became great through experimentation. Our tradition is one of 
protest and revolt, and it is stultifying to celebrate the rebels of the 
past while we silence the rebels of the present."
-Henry Steele Commager

Hmmmmmmmmm, i can kinda feel him on the 2.  More so Jeno though.  I've never really been impressed with him or his sets.  Mark he'l always hold a spot in my heart.  His cd's pretty much all rock, save a couple of them.  and for the most party he's at least a consistant dj.  The last handful of times i've seen him, i've had mixed feelings.  A few of them have been really good sets, but some of them have been really mellow and too downtempo for me, nothing to motivate me to dance which i dont like.  But so far as i've noticed it's up to par with most big name dj's.  they just dont motivate me to sweat my ass off dancing like they used to.  could be a product of their environment or the music they're picking...who knows.

> > It's got something to do with the speed of the beats. It's hypnotic,
> > tribal, and primal. That particular speed has worked for thousands of
> > years, which is why you can spin in Arab music, Bhangra music, Aboriginal
> > music... You can take all these different cultures and find the same
> beat,
> > between 125-130 bpm. It's there in ecstatic, trance music, where people
> > shake and spin until they reach a state of hyperventilation and
> psychedelic
> > alpha-wave experience. In a sense (house) is regressive music. You're
> going
> > back to the roots of why music was invented: to reach ecstatic and
> > visionary states, in a communal tribal celebration.
> > 
> > Simon Reynolds, "Where 'now' lasts longer,"
> > in Blissed Out (London: Serpent's Tail, 1990)
> >

Yeah, totally..  For vegas, undergrounds are almost non-existant.  Take
nice clothes for the clubs they got there or they'll turn you away at
the door.  If you're under 21 the best way to party is to have a 21+
along for the ride with ya and get the yard o' margaritas and walk the
strip.  

Word of warning:  While it may look like fun, do not have sex with two
girls while smoking up, then steal a ferrari with a gun in it, shoot a
bouncer after touching some strippers and getting chased by goons.  It
tends to end your vacation short.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] vegas

Check out Rubber at the Palms.  Seven (Alesium) is on the strip, and is
tight on Saturdays after 3am .  House of Blues Monday night.
Also for after after hours after 6am, check out Glo at Ibiza USA (across
from Seven on the strip)
Drai's used to be tight, but turned a little commercial. Havent been there
in a while.

Ps- these are all 21+ with fashionable clothes.

Expect long lines and at least $30-40 at the doors.
If you are looking the inexpensive route, try the Hard Rock center bar or
Baby's at Hard Rock, or just hang out in front of Rain at Palms the lobby is
literally a mad house.  Also Mandalay Bay is cool.  For a big weekend,
expect to drop some coin. They pump up the prices.

Peace.
cF

Friday, May 23, 2003 ** DEVILISH **

No Limits SF would like to thank the 300 plus people who attended "CREAM".
If you didn't make it to the party, or if you missed some of the fun,
don't forget to visit www.nolimitssf.com to view the pictures.

We have great news! We would like to invite all of you to "DEVILISH", on
May 23rd, 2003. Once again, the party will be sponsored by Belvedere
Vodka! & our new Special Sponsor Fernet-Branka, the finest Italian liquer!

For this special event, our guests from CTA Productions will perform an
unforgettable-all night laser show!

This event will take place at Club Hide located @ 280 - 7th Street in San
Francisco. Please visit www.clubhide.com for more info.

For this special event, we will be having our popular Bay Area DJ's:

Main Dance Floor:  DJ Ecko - will be spinning European grooves.  CJ Pollux
- will entice you with his Euro-trance Set.  DJ uv13 - will rock you with
the newest vocal and Euro-trance hits.  DJ Stranger - has prepared a
special set that will make you sweat!

Second Floor Lounge:  DJ Funk - will bring this room to life with Funkiest
of house beats. DJ 2 - will be spinning the latest R&B and Hip-Hop cutz.

You don't want to miss this special "Devilish" event, as this party will
be wilder than the last! For more information please visit
www.nolimitsSF.com or call our info line at 415.675.5821. For Limo
service, table and a bottle, make your reservations by email at
info@nolimitssf.com.

$5 before 10.30pm with devilish attire $5 for ladies before 11pm $15 cover
charge all night


Note: Special treatment for B-Day People, email us for more info!


=2E.:Proudly Sponsored by Belvedere Vodka, Fernet-Branca, and JAS
Limousine:..
